Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched a perfect game with 20 strikeouts
Aaron Judge makes catch to secure final out, helping Yankees eliminate Royals and advance to ALCS
Torres hit the veteran right-hander's first pitch of the game for a double, and Soto followed with an RBI single on just the third pitch of the night
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres and Game 3 star Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees
Cole only seemed to get stronger as he clicked off innings
Witt, who had been 1 for 15 in the series, followed with a base hit and Vinnie Pasquantino — who'd been 0 for 14 — had an RBI double
Cole got Salvador Perez to pop out lazily to second base to end the inning
Pre-Game Insights: New York will play Cleveland or Detroit in the ALCS starting Monday night at Yankee Stadium
The Guardians forced a winner-take all Game 5 with a win over the Tigers on Thursday, and that game will take place Saturday
They won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years
With young stars such as Bobby Witt Jr. signed to long-term deals, there is hope in Kansas City that this was a beginning rather than an ending
Post-Match Reflections: Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres and Game 3 star Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees, who fittingly clinched the series on the road
Michael Wacha failed to get through five innings for Kansas City, allowing two runs, six hits and a walk
It was a remarkable turnaround for a club that went from 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making its first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series
And with young stars such as Bobby Witt Jr. signed to long-term deals, there is hope in Kansas City that this was a beginning rather than an ending
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace Thursday night, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings and sending the New York Yankees to a 3-1 victory
The six-time All-Star scattered six hits and struck out four before handing the ball to the New York bullpen
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning and Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 2/3 innings this postseason
The near-fracas nearly ignited Kansas City, too. Witt, who had been 1 for 15 in the series, followed with a base hit and Vinnie Pasquantino — who'd been 0 for 14 — had an RBI double
